member.name: T:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.DomParser
member.summary: A way for JavaScript applications to access the parser. See: https://w3c.github.io/DOM-Parsing/#the-domparser-interface

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.DomParser.#ctor(AngleSharp.Dom.IWindow)
member.summary: Creates a new DOMParser instance.
member.param: The window to host the parser.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.DomParser.Parse(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the given string for the given type. Throws a not supported exception if the type is not supported.
member.param: The type of the target to parse to.
member.returns: The document of the given type.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.RequesterState
member.summary: Defines the states of the requester.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.RequesterState.Unsent
member.summary: Nothing has been sent yet.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.RequesterState.Opened
member.summary: The communication channel is open.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.RequesterState.HeadersReceived
member.summary: The response headers have been received.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.RequesterState.Loading
member.summary: The body is still incoming.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.RequesterState.Done
member.summary: The response has been received.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.Screen
member.summary: Represents information about the screen of the output device.

member.summary: Gets the available width of the rendering surface of the output device, in CSS pixels.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.Screen.AvailableHeight
member.summary: Gets the available height of the rendering surface of the output device, in CSS pixels.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.Screen.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of the output device, in CSS pixels.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.Screen.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the output device, in CSS pixels.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.Screen.ColorDepth
member.summary: Gets the value 24 - by specification.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.Screen.PixelDepth
member.summary: Gets the value 24 - by specification.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.WindowBase64
member.summary: Represents the WindowBase64 auxiliary interface implemented by Window.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.WindowBase64.#ctor(AngleSharp.Dom.IWindow)
member.summary: Creates a new WindowBase64 auxiliary class.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.WindowBase64.btoa(System.String)
member.summary: Takes the input data, in the form of a Unicode string containing only characters in the range U+0000 to U+00FF, each representing a binary byte with values 0x00 to 0xFF respectively, and converts it to its base64 representation, which it returns.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Scripting.JavaScript.Dom.WindowBase64.atob(System.String)
member.summary: Takes the input data, in the form of a Unicode string containing base64-encoded binary data, decodes it, and returns a string consisting of characters in the range U+0000 to U+00FF, each representing a binary byte with values 0x00 to 0xFF respectively, corresponding to that binary data.
